html:
** Shares of Amazon AMZN.O, Apple AAPL.O, Meta Platforms FB.O, Alphabet GOOGL.O, Microsoft MSFT.O and Tesla TSLA.O down between 1.2% and 1.6% premarket

** Broader market dragged down by concerns about the impact of tighter restrictions as the Omicron variant of the coronavirus spreads rapidly .N

** Apple, which is a few billions short of $3 trillion market cap, is now trading at ~$169, nearly $14 short of its target

** In India, a key market for Apple, co has asked antitrust watchdog to throw out a case alleging abuse of market power in the apps market (Full Story)

** The country's antitrust agency also suspended Amazon's 2019 deal with Future Group, India's no. 2 retailer (Full Story)

** Separately, a key Senate Democrat said he would not support a spending bill that included a dramatic boost to EV tax credits, bringing down shares of EV firms including Tesla (Full Story)

** For the year, all stocks have risen - GOOGL leading with ~62% gain and Amazon with the least increase of 4.4%



(Reporting by Nivedita Balu in Bengaluru)

(( Nivedita.Balu@thomsonreuters.com ; Twitter: https://twitter.com/niveditabalu; ))
